Key Match Events: Bangladesh lost the match by 4 runs
Jaker Ali was caught by Aiden Markram on the straight boundary trying to hit the six that would win it for them
Taskin Ahmed bowled Markram with a delivery that moved just enough off the pitch
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller batted through the next 14 overs together and put on a match-winning 75
Post-Match Reflections: Mahmudullah couldn't believe it, and stood his ground a while, waiting for a review that never came
They deserved better, especially Towhid Hridoy, who had held everything together with his fine 37
Miscellaneous Highlights: The number of Bangladeshi-Americans living in New York has tripled in the past decade, and now runs to approximately 100,000
It was the second-biggest crowd they have had here during the tournament, a little smaller than Indiaâ€™s, but just as loud
Others: Tanzim Hasan Sakib was brought in to bolster the fast bowling
Quinton de Kock carted him for a six over square leg and then a four through long-on in the first over
Reeza Hendricks was dismissed lbw by Hasan in the first over
Tristan Stubbs was caught at cover for a duck
Henriques Klaasen raced ahead with a couple of sixes off Hossain
David Miller, who was celebrating his 35th birthday, tucked in behind him
Taskin finally broke the partnership when he bowled Klaasen for 46
When Hossain got Miller in the next over, the innings spluttered out
